term.title: elementary charge

item.text: The elementary charge, e, is one of seven fixed constants defining the International System of Units, the SI, with e = 1.602 176 634 x 10-19 C. The elementary charge e corresponds to a coupling strength of the electromagnetic force via the fine-structure constant and is considered as a fundamental constant of nature.

sources.item: BIPM, The International System of Units, SI Brochure, 9th ed. (2019), p. 127ff (https://www.bipm.org/en/publications/si-brochure/)
